documentation: # Webflow This guide walks you through setting up the Webflow integration within Boltic. ## Prerequisites To set up the Webflow integration, you'll need: - A Webflow account You can create an account at Webflow. ## Setting Up the Webflow Integration in Boltic 1. **Log In** - Log into your Webflow account. 2. **Log into Boltic** - Log into your Boltic account or navigate to the Boltic Open Source dashboard. 3. **Navigate to Integrations** - Click on `Sources` and then click on `+ Add New source`. 4. **Select Source Type** - On the Set up the source page, search for `Webflow` from the search bar and select it. 5. **Create a Connection** - Click `Create a Connection`. - Optional: In the **Connection name** field, enter a name for the connection. - Optional: Click `Show Advanced Settings` and enter your custom app's client credentials. To create a custom app, refer to the [Webflow OAuth2.0: App Registration documentation](https://university.webflow.com/lesson/oauth-2-0-authentication). - Note: If requested, use the following redirect URI: https://www.integromat.com/oauth/cb/webflow2. 6. **Authenticate Webflow Account** - Click `Save`. - If prompted, log in to your Webflow account and confirm the access. 7. **Details (Optional)** - **Tags:** Add any tags for categorization. - **Description:** Provide a brief description of the integration. 8. **Test and Save Integration** - Click `Test Connection` to ensure the connection is successful. - Once the connection test is successful, click `Set up source` to complete the configuration. ## Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) 1. **How do I find my Webflow API token?** - To obtain your Webflow API token, navigate to your Webflow project settings and look for the API tokens section. For detailed instructions, refer to Webflow's official documentation on [API tokens](https://university.webflow.com/lesson/api-tokens). 2. **What should I do if my connection fails?** - Ensure your API token is correct and valid. - Verify that the client ID and client secret (if using a custom app) are accurate. - Double-check the domain URL for any typos. - Ensure your Webflow account has the necessary permissions. - Check your network connection and firewall settings for potential issues. 3. **How often is the data synced?** - The data sync frequency depends on the settings you configure during the setup process. You can customize the sync frequency based on your needs. 4. **Can I customize the data being synced?** - Yes, you can customize the data being synced by selecting specific modules and configuring the relevant settings during the setup process. ## Support If you need further assistance, please contact Boltic support or visit our Support Documentation.
